page.title: 14DARLINGTONS MUSHROOMS
page.content: Darlingtons, a major producer of mushrooms in the UK, with an output of Â£12 million per year. Production is 60,000 lbs a week. First, trays are filled with compost. Next they're taken to the peak heat rooms. They stay there for 7 days for pasteurisation. Then the compost is through-spawned by machines on rye grains and pressed with ram pressure. Next, trays are taken to spawn running rooms for 10-12 days. A casing of peat and chalk is put on. The trays are taken to the cropping house and watered and the temperature and humidity can be controlled at 20-24c 90% humidity for about 10-12 days. Then lowered to 18c 80% humidity as mushrooms form. Trays come into crop 21 days from casing. These are "Blue Prince" mushrooms sold to supermarkets.
